# useToggle

Returns a stateful boolean and a function to toggle it.
Additionally, adds an effect which sets the state to true if any errors are found.

## Parameters

| Param        | Type          | Description          |
| ------------ | ------------- | -------------------- |
| initialState | `boolean`     | the initial state.   |
| errors       | `Array.<any>` | the array of errors. |

## Returns

`useToggle~Return` - tuple which can be used to control a collapsible.

## Example

```js
import {Collapsible, useToggle} from '@bluecateng/pelagos';

const Example = ({errors}) => {
	const [open, toggleOpen] = useToggle(false, errors);
	return (
		<Collapsible open={open} onHeaderClick={toggleOpen}>
			...
		</Collapsible>
	);
};
```

## Other types

### useToggle~Return

`Array` - return type for `useToggle`.

#### Properties

| Name | Type       | Description                   |
| ---- | ---------- | ----------------------------- |
| 0    | `boolean`  | the current value.            |
| 1    | `function` | function to toggle the value. |
